instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
threads.message:
Similar to my other recent post except no video internal or external. No image or backlight. 
This was a fully working MacBook that had a cracked display. Customer brought into a local shop that replaced the display resulting in this. Caps lights up, fans spin, in-line meter appears to show the Mac is on. 
Disp connector on board/display side board and cable all look good (no charring on 43 & 1). Difference with this one is PP3v3/ <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> are at 0v. 

Went ahead and replaced <CHIP>U8950</CHIP> with some change in values but no change in function. Values before and after are below. 

1) <SIGNAL>EDP_AUXCH_C_N</SIGNAL> - 0.693 > 0.469
3) <SIGNAL>EDP_AUXCH_C_P</SIGNAL> - 0.693 > 0.464
7) <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><0> - 0.420 > 0.378
9) <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><0> - 0.418 > 0.379
13) <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><1> - 0.418 > 0.379
15) <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><1> - 0.417 > 0.379
19) <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><2> - 0.422 > 0.380
21) <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><2 - 0.416 > 0.378
25) <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_N</SIGNAL><3> 0.416 > 0.380
27) <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_ML_P</SIGNAL><3> - 0.416 > 0.380
4) <SIGNAL>BUF_EDP_PANEL_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> - 0.726 > 0.718

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
threads.message: You should get some voltage pulse on LCD connector power rails at least in first seconds.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
threads.message:
I do not get any pulse on PP3v3/ <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> with display connected or without. I do get PP3v3/ <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> on <CHIP>U8500</CHIP>/01 and other S0 rails. 

Does this point to <CHIP>U8500</CHIP>/01/10 for creation of <SIGNAL>S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
threads.message:
Does that have firmware? You don't seem very optimistic.. 
Worth trying <CHIP>U9800</CHIP> first?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
threads.message:
PCH should first (temporary) enable power for LCD and waits <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> confirmation from it.
PCH has no firmware, but requires clean ME BIOS after changed is done.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
threads.message: I can do ME Region but only have 00281 parts board.. all donors donâ€™t have this. Will that work?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No video
threads.message:
Check Intel marking code on PCH; something like SR30W, etc...
You can buy new, or remove from any other board (nor only Apple brand).
